title: Box Office: â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™ Kicks Off With $88 Million Domestic Debut
description: â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ ignited with $88 million in its domestic box office debut. Itâ€™s a decent start, albeit a significant decline from the opening
body:
â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ ignited with $88 million in its domestic box office debut. Itâ€™s a decent start, albeit a significant decline from the opening weekend of 2022â€™s sequel â€œAvatar: The Way of Waterâ€ with $134 million. However a larger question looms about the financial fate of the big-budget blockbuster: How will James Cameronâ€™s third trip to Pandora hold over the holiday season?

	Thatâ€™s important because â€œAvatarâ€ films are known, not for fiery opening weekends, but rather for their unparalleled box office staying power. The original 2009 epic â€œAvatarâ€ debuted to $77 million domestically and remained in first place for seven consecutive weekends, eventually climbing to $760 million in North America and $2.92 billion worldwide. Not to be outdone, the sequel also managed to hold onto the No. 1 spot for seven weekends and ended up earning $688 million domestically and $2.3 billion globally. 
	

	â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ also debuted behind projections at the international box office with $257 million, bringing its global tally to $345 million. Thatâ€™s one of the biggest worldwide debuts of the year while also ranking dramatically behind the second filmâ€™s $435 million global debut.


	Based on initial ticket sales for â€œAvatar 3,â€ which landed below expectations of $90 million to $105 million domestically, the otherworldly adventure appears to be experiencing diminishing returns. Itâ€™s unclear, however, what exactly diminishing returns will look like for the follow-up to two of the highest-grossing films in history. â€œAvatarâ€ adventures carry enormous budgets, costing at least $350 million to produce and millions more to market. Cameron once said that â€œThe Way of Waterâ€ needed to become one of theÂ top-grossing releases of all timeÂ to break even. (It did.) The newest â€œAvatarâ€ doesnâ€™t necessarily need to surpass the $2 billion mark to be successful, but its safe to assume that â€œFire and Ashâ€ needs to become a box office behemoth to justify its massive price tag.
	

	â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ has several factors thatâ€™ll work in its favor, including an â€œAâ€ grade on CinemaScore exit polls, the upcoming Christmas stretch (which is the most popular time of year for moviegoing) and, of course, Cameronâ€™s unmatched track record. Cameron is the only filmmaker with three movies to generate more than $2 billion, the other being â€œTitanic.â€ Although a daunting 3-hour-plus runtime has never deterred audiences for â€œAvatarâ€ installments,â€ the newest filmâ€™s three hours and 17 minute length does limit the number of showtimes per day. And while  â€œAvatar: The Way of Waterâ€ was plagued by endless release date delays, it ended up contributing to pent-up demand over 13 years. The third entry is arriving a comparatively short three years after its predecessor.

	â€œOpenings are not what theÂ â€˜Avatarâ€™Â movies are about. Itâ€™s what they doÂ afterÂ they open that made them the No. 2 and three biggest films of all time,â€ says David A. Gross, who runs the movie consulting firm Franchise Entertainment Research. â€œIt will be several weeks before we really know how well the film is doing.â€ 

	â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ loomed large over domestic box office charts, but it wasnâ€™t the only new nationwide release. In a surprising finish, Angel Studios animated biblical musical drama â€œDavidâ€ emerged ahead of two other newcomers,  Lionsgateâ€™s psychological thriller â€œThe Housemaidâ€ and Paramountâ€™s â€œThe SpongeBob Movie: Search for SquarePants.â€ 

	â€œDavid,â€ a kid-friendly take on the story of David and Goliath and follow-up to the TV mini-series â€œYoung David, collected $22 million from 3,118 screens. Those ticket sales mark the best three-day debut for the faith-based Angel Studios, surpassing â€œSound of Freedom,â€ which ignited to $19.6 million and became a sleeper hit with more than $250 million. 

	â€œFamilies are searching for values-driven films that honor hope,â€ said Angelâ€™s head of theatrical Brandon Purdie. â€œWe look forward to a robust theatrical run as this popular animated musical continues to warm hearts and inspire families this Christmas.â€ 

	â€œThe Housemaidâ€ started strong in third place with $19 million from 3,015 theaters. Initial crowds were 70% female and 75% above the age of 25, according to PostTrak. They gave the film a â€œBâ€ grade on CinemaScore exit polls, which isnâ€™t unusual for a movie that leaves audiences feeling unsettled as they leave the theater. Lionsgate is hoping the film, starring Sydney Sweeney and Amanda Seyfried, becomes a breakout hit among women in the vein of â€œA Simple Favor,â€ â€œAnyone but You,â€ or â€œIt Ends With Usâ€ (butÂ without the off-screen drama). Directed by Paul Feig (â€œBridesmaidsâ€) and adapted from the best-selling novel by Freida McFadden, the R-rated film follows an ex-con who becomes the live-in maid for an ultra-wealthy family.
	

	â€œSpongeBobâ€ was No. 4 with $16 million from 3,557 locations. The PG-rated film, based on the hit Nickelodeon television show, cost $64 million to produce. Initial ticket sales are by far the lowest of the two prior â€œSpongeBobâ€ theatrical adventures. The first, 2004â€™s â€œThe SpongeBob SquarePants Movie, launched with $32 million, while the second, 2015â€™s â€œThe SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water,â€ film opened to $55 million. Luckily moviegoers seem to dig â€œSearch for SquarePants,â€ which earned an â€œA-â€ grade on CinemaScore, the highest of the series.

	More to comeâ€¦

schema.headline: Box Office: â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™ Kicks Off With $88 Million Domestic Debut

title: TikTokâ€™s U.S. Ownership Raises Concerns for Creators at First TikTok Awards Show: â€˜I Want People to Create Without Worrying About Being Punishedâ€™
description: The most influential content creators were celebrated on Thursday night for their impact and contributions to popular internet culture at the inaugu
body:
The most influential content creators were celebrated on Thursday night for their impact and contributions to popular internet culture at the inaugural TikTok Awards, held at the Hollywood Palladium and live-streamed on the social media app as well as on Tubi.

	â€‹Just hours before the start of the event, news broke that TikTok and ByteDance signed agreements with three managing investors â€“ Oracle, Silverlake and MGXâ€“ to form a new TikTok U.S. joint venture. The agreement, which is set to close Jan. 22, 2026, would ensure that the popular social media platform will continue operating in the United States. â€‹
	

	While this latest development is one step closer to preventing the app from being banned in the U.S., the uncertainty about how the app will change with its new investors was unsettling for many content creators at the awards ceremony.


	On the red carpet, attendees shared their concerns about the future of the app particularly with Oracle, a software company run by billionaire and Donald Trumpâ€™s close ally Larry Ellison, as one of the new American investors in the deal.â€‹

	â€œK-pop Demon Huntersâ€ star Rei Ami told Variety, â€œI would be afraid of the censorship. I hope TikTok remains firm in its pledge not to censor their creators. Censorship goes against what Americaâ€™s founding principles are. Censorship remaining out of usersâ€™ creative ability is what I hope and want for TikTokâ€™s future.â€



	

					Paris Hilton and Rei Ami at TikTok Awards 2025 at Hollywood Palladium on December 18, 2025 in Los Angeles, California. (Christopher Polk/Billboard)
									Billboard via Getty Images
	



	â€‹TikTok star Merrick Hanna, who rose to internet stardom for his signature robotic dance moves, mentioned how he hopes â€œthey donâ€™t change the app too much.â€ He added, â€œIâ€™m worried that the owners are going to sway what kind of content is going to get served to people on their For You Page. I hope that doesnâ€™t happen.â€â€‹
	

	â€œOvercompensatingâ€ actress and content creator Yasmine Sahid said sheâ€™s worried about TikTokâ€™s algorithm being impacted. â€œIâ€™m a little bit nervous because I want the algorithm to stay true and freedom of speech. I want people to create without worrying about being punished or banned. So weâ€™ll see.â€â€‹

	Beauty TikToker Golloria George, who built a massive platform on promoting makeup inclusivity, shared her concerns about whether TikTok stays true to its core. â€œI hope it stays authentic and doesnâ€™t censor creators for having a voice. The beauty of the platform is that people can get on TikTok and say what they want to say. That is most important.â€â€‹



	

					Golloria George at the TikTok Awards 2025 held at Hollywood Palladium on December 18, 2025 in Los Angeles, California. (River Callaway/Variety)
									Variety via Getty Images
	



	Despite their concerns, the shared sentiment of relief was present among the content creators and influencers, knowing that the pending deal would prevent TikTok from being banned in the U.S.â€‹

	â€œIâ€™m excited, but also mentally drained because the algorithm is so confusing right now,â€ TikTok star Markell Washington said. â€œFrom a creatorâ€™s perspective, the algorithm is making me feel like I have to do backflips and jump off a building to get views. Hopefully, after itâ€™s sold, it can get back to normal with the original algorithm because itâ€™s taking the fun out of creating. Iâ€™m creating content and trying to evolve with the algorithm, but itâ€™s not getting rewarded at the same time.â€‹â€

	With how much TikTok has changed the lives of business owners, Canadian influencer and businessman Josh Richards said he was happy to hear that the platform found buyers.â€‹

	â€œTikTok has given so many people a way to create an income or business,â€ he said. â€œWhat itâ€™s been able to do in the small business world is incredible. Itâ€™s been able to help kids to feed that hunger inside of them as a creative outlet. They have such easy access to that now.â€

	Hosted by La La Anthony, the TikTok Awards crowned New Orleans-based Keith Lee with the Creator of the Year Award. With 17.3 million TikTok followers, Leeâ€™s videos spotlight small food businesses and uses his platform to drive massive customer demand that have turned restaurants into overnight successes.
	



	

					Keith Lee wins the Creator of the Year Award at the TikTok Awards 2025 held at Hollywood Palladium on December 18, 2025 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Christopher Polk/Billboard)
									Billboard via Getty Images
	



	â€œThis means more to me than I can explain,â€ Lee said while accepting his award. â€œI was just a kid sitting in a PAW Patrol chair that started recording because I was a professional fighter who was nervous in front of cameras and couldnâ€™t talk. I couldnâ€™t be rooms with people. I was a nervous wreck who always doubted myself. TikTok provided me a platform to talk about that and highlight small businesses around the country.â€

	He continued, â€œItâ€™s so hard for me to do something for myself because I always put other people in front of me. But this is for me.â€

	After his speech, Anthony announced that TikTok pledged $50,000 to Feeding America to help fight against food insecurity.

	Throughout the night, the award show featured special surprises, including a performance from â€œDancing With the Starsâ€ duo Jordan Chiles and Ezra Sosa, TikTok shop giveaways and a Labubu cannon that launched the plush toys into the audience.

	Ciara also took center stage to perform as headliner. The music superstar performed a combination of her classics and newer songs, including â€œMy Goodies,â€ â€œOh,â€ â€œLike a Boy,â€ â€œLevel Up,â€ â€œ1, 2 Step,â€ among others.

	Across 14 categories, fans were able to cast their votes for their favorite creators in the TikTok appâ€™s awards hub from Nov. 18 to Dec. 2. Other winners from the night were Bretman Rock (Video of the Year), Jeremiah Brown (Rising Star of the Year), Alex Warren (Breakthrough Artist of the Year), Tineke Younger (Storyteller of the Year), Paris Hilton (Muse of the Year), Zach and Pat Valentine (TikTok For Good Award), Dayane Chrissel (My Show Is On), Mariah Rose (MVP of the Year), Katie Fang (Okay Slay), Law By Mike (I Was Today Years Old), KlothesMinded (Immediately Added To Cart), Recider (CapCut Creator of the Year), Elizabeth Esparza (TikTok Live Creator of the Year).

schema.headline: TikTokâ€™s U.S. Ownership Raises Concerns for Creators at First TikTok Awards Show: â€˜I Want People to Create Without Worrying About Being Punishedâ€™

title: Ariana Grande Spoofs Mariah Careyâ€™s â€˜All I Want for Christmas Is Youâ€™ With Bowen Yang in â€˜SNLâ€™ Monologue
description: Ariana Grande belted out her own rendition of Mariah Careyâ€™s â€œAll I Want for Christmas Is Youâ€ during her â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ monologue about the
body:
Ariana Grande belted out her own rendition of Mariah Careyâ€™s â€œAll I Want for Christmas Is Youâ€ during her â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ monologue about the difficulties of of buying presents for acquaintances and friends of friends, titled â€œWhat Do I Get for Christmas for This Dude?â€

	Saturday marked the Christmas episode of this â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ Season 51, with Grande as host and Cher as her musical guest. It also was cast member Bowen Yangâ€™s final episode, as news broke Friday that he would be exiting the show. Yang, who appeared with Grande in â€œWickedâ€ and this yearâ€™s â€œWicked: For Good,â€ joined her on stage for her spoof of Careyâ€™s song.
	

	â€œDecember is my favorite time of year in New York,â€ Grande began. â€œI love the decorations, the snow on the ground. I love shopping for all my loved ones. But I have to admit, I get a little stressed shopping for certain other people in my life.â€


	The â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ audience cheered when they realized Grande was doing her own take on â€œAll I Want for Christmas Is Youâ€


	â€œI donâ€™t know what to get for Christmas for my cousinâ€™s boyfriend Steve,â€ she sang to Careyâ€™s tune. â€œI donâ€™t know a thing about him, only see him on Christmas Eve.â€

	She also poked fun at her seemingly non-stop press tour for â€œWicked: For Good,â€ joking that her director Jon M. Chu wouldnâ€™t give her any bathroom breaks.

	â€œHavenâ€™t shopped a lot for Christmas, â€˜cuz my scheduleâ€™s never free,â€ she sang. â€œHad so much press for â€˜Wicked,â€™ Jon Chu will not let me pee.â€
	

	When Yang joined her on stage, Grande teased that he had very few lines in â€œWickedâ€: â€œCan I just say how much I loved your line in â€˜Wickedâ€™?â€

	â€œThank you,â€ he said, to which Grande replied â€œyouâ€™re welcome!â€

	â€œNo,â€ Yang clarified. â€œThat was my line.â€

	Saturdayâ€™s episode marked Grandeâ€™s third time hosting â€œSNL,â€ one of which she doubled as the musical guest. Sheâ€™s also performed solely as the musical guest twice.

schema.headline: Ariana Grande Spoofs Mariah Careyâ€™s â€˜All I Want for Christmas Is Youâ€™ With Bowen Yang in â€˜SNLâ€™ Monologue

title: Michael Che Makes Colin Jost Insult Wife Scarlett Johansson in â€˜SNLâ€™ Joke Swap: â€˜Bâ€”- You Having a Hot Flashâ€™
description: â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ stars Colin Jost and Michael Che continued their yearly Christmas tradition of writing horribly offensive jokes for the other
body:
â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ stars Colin Jost and Michael Che continued their yearly Christmas tradition of writing horribly offensive jokes for the other person to tell on Weekend Update. Except this year, Che lied to Jost that they werenâ€™t doing their annual swap but still prepared his own â€” so Jost was the only one reading out jokes, much to Che and the audienceâ€™s delight.

	Che did not hold back for Jost once again, one year after he made his co-host tell some harsh jokes about Jostâ€™s wife Scarlett Johansson, who was backstage watching.
	

	â€œCritics say a new series of coins from the U.S. Mint celebrating great moments in the countryâ€™s history ignore civil rights. But what about the coin that celebrates where Black people actually come from â€” ships,â€ Jost began reading reluctantly as Che laughed at his joke.


	Jost continued: â€œThe archdiocese of New York will set up a fund for victims of church sexual abuse. Yet I get nothing for keeping my mouth shut and taking it like a champ?â€ The audience gasped and laughed as Jost read his final prepared joke, while Che said Jost shouldâ€™ve written some for him.

	â€œNew research shows that millions of women leave the work force due to menopause. Which means thereâ€™s only a couple years left on my gravy train,â€ a photo of Johansson flashed on the screen as Jost grimaced. â€œMy girl already be like, â€˜Colin, Iâ€™m warm. Colin, Iâ€™m sweating.â€™ Bitch, you having a hot flash.â€

	â€œBut donâ€™t worry about me, I got a backup. They donâ€™t call Wednesday hump day for nothing,â€ Jost finished, as a photo of Jenna Ortegaâ€™s Netflix character Wednesday Addams popped on screen.

schema.headline: Michael Che Makes Colin Jost Insult Wife Scarlett Johansson in â€˜SNLâ€™ Joke Swap: â€˜Bâ€”- You Having a Hot Flashâ€™

title: Yashâ€™s â€˜Toxicâ€™ Unveils First Look of Kiara Advani as Nadia (EXCLUSIVE)
description: The filmmakers behind Yashâ€˜s highly anticipated â€œToxic â€“ A Fairytale for Grown-Upsâ€ have revealed the first look at Kiara Advaniâ€˜s character Nadia,
body:
The filmmakers behind Yashâ€˜s highly anticipated â€œToxic â€“ A Fairytale for Grown-Upsâ€ have revealed the first look at Kiara Advaniâ€˜s character Nadia, offering a glimpse into what promises to be a transformative role for the actor.

	The poster presents Advani set against a circus backdrop, balancing glamorous aesthetics with underlying emotional depth that suggests grief and melancholy beneath the surface spectacle. The character appears poised to showcase a different dimension of Advaniâ€™s range as she enters the distinctive cinematic world.
	

	Advani has established herself as one of Hindi cinemaâ€™s most bankable stars following breakthrough performances in the romantic drama â€œKabir Singhâ€ and the biographical war film â€œShershaah.â€ Her recent slate includes â€œGame Changerâ€ and â€œWar 2.â€


	Yash, the Kannada-language film industry actor who rose to pan-Indian stardom with the â€œK.G.Fâ€ franchise, has become one of the most sought-after stars in Indian cinema. Known for his portrayal of Rocky Bhai in â€œK.G.F: Chapter 1â€ (2018) and â€œK.G.F: Chapter 2â€ (2022) Yashâ€™s transformation into a larger-than-life action hero propelled the films to unprecedented box-office success, breaking language barriers. The second instalment in the franchise is the fifth highest Indian grosser of all time. While the â€œK.G.Fâ€ series cemented his star power, Yashâ€™s early career in Kannada-language films showcased his versatility, with notable performances in projects such as â€œMr. and Mrs. Ramachariâ€ (2014) and â€œGooglyâ€ (2013).

	â€œToxicâ€ is helmed by festival circuit darlingÂ Geetu MohandasÂ (â€œMoothonâ€).Â The ambitious project represents a watershed moment for Kannada cinema, which has been steadily gaining international traction following the â€œK.G.Fâ€ phenomenon. Written by Yash and Mohandas, â€œToxicâ€ is breaking new ground as the first major Indian film conceptualized,Â written and shot simultaneously in both the Kannada and English languagesÂ â€“ with dubbed versions planned for Hindi, Telugu, Tamil, Malayalam and additional languages.
	

	â€œSome performances donâ€™t just belong to a film they redefine an artist,â€ said Mohandas. â€œWhat Kiara created on screen in this film is nothing short of transformative. From our very first conversation, she placed an unwavering trust in a character that demanded everything from her â€“ be it emotionally, mentally, and artistically. She didnâ€™t just play the role, she lived it. As a director, I am deeply proud of her and for the performance she has delivered, and for the faith and heart she brought into our shared journey.â€

	The reveal arrives as Yash prepares for his first screen appearance since â€œK.G.F: Chapter 2â€ redefined box office benchmarks four years ago. The announcement coincides with the seventh anniversary of the original â€œK.G.F,â€ which launched the phenomenon that would culminate in the sequelâ€™s historic performance.

	The production has assembled a notable technical crew including Indian National Film Award-winning cinematographer Rajeev Ravi, composer Ravi Basrur, editor Ujwal Kulkarni and production designer T.P. Abid. Action sequences have been choreographed by Hollywoodâ€™s J.J. Perry, known for his work on â€œJohn Wick,â€ alongside Indian National Film Award-winning duo Anbariv.

	Produced by Venkat K. Narayana and Yash through KVN Productions and Monster Mind Creations, â€œToxic â€“ A Fairytale for Grown-Upsâ€ is scheduled for theatrical release March 19, 2026, capitalizing on the extended holiday weekend that encompasses Eid, Ugadi and Gudi Padwa celebrations.

schema.headline: Yashâ€™s â€˜Toxicâ€™ Unveils First Look of Kiara Advani as Nadia (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Finn Wolfhard to Host First â€˜SNLâ€™ of New Year, A$AP Rocky Will Be Musical Guest
description:
The first â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ episode of 2026 will be hosted by Finn Wolfhard, with musical guest A$AP Rocky.

	The episode, which premieres on Ja
body:
The first â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ episode of 2026 will be hosted by Finn Wolfhard, with musical guest A$AP Rocky.

	The episode, which premieres on Jan. 17, comes weeks after the series finale of Wolfhardâ€™s series â€œStranger Things.â€ Meanwhile, Rocky will be performing music from his upcoming album â€œDonâ€™t Be Dumb,â€ which is set to drop on Jan. 16.

	Although the final episode of Netflixâ€™s blockbuster â€œStranger Thingsâ€ is set to debut on Dec. 31, Wolfhard told Variety that heâ€™s never really going to leave the show behind. 
	

	â€œThe way for me to sort of advance in my life and my career is not to try to replace the show. Itâ€™s to try to really embrace it,â€ he said in the interview. â€œBecause to fight it would be the wrong thing to do, because then youâ€™re forgetting where everything started.â€


	Rocky spoke with Variety about the early â€œDonâ€™t Be Dumbâ€ single â€œHighjack,â€ which features singer-songwriter Jessica Pratt.

	â€œI like to do things that donâ€™t make sense,â€ he said in the interview. â€œNobody would have thought to put [folk musician] Jessica Pratt on that, but I think her voice is so angelic. She literally let me write the whole thing, and she just sang it beautifully. She makes me want to be like a secret songwriter; I should probably get into writing folk songs. Sheâ€™s sick.â€

	The announcement was made during the Dec. 20 episode of â€œSaturday Night Live,â€ which was hosted by Ariana Grande with musical guest Cher. The episode was also the final show for Bowen Yang, who confirmed his departure earlier that day.

schema.headline: Finn Wolfhard to Host First â€˜SNLâ€™ of New Year, A$AP Rocky Will Be Musical Guest

title: Bowen Yang Pays Tribute to â€˜SNLâ€™ in Tearful Final Sketch: â€˜This Is My Last Shift, Iâ€™m Gonna Miss Everything About This Placeâ€™Â
description:
Bowen Yang said goodbye to â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ with the final sketch of the night, which was also his last.

	News broke on Friday that Saturdayâ€™s
body:
Bowen Yang said goodbye to â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ with the final sketch of the night, which was also his last.

	News broke on Friday that Saturdayâ€™s episode would be Yangâ€™s final appearance as part of the â€œSNLâ€ cast after being on the show for eight seasons. He first joined â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ as a writer in 2018 in Season 44 and later was added to the cast as a featured player in Season 45. He was upped to be a main cast member in Season 47. 
	

	In the sketch, Yang played a flight attendant with a broken eggnog machine at the Delta One lounge who was leaving for his final shift.


	â€œThis is my last shift. Itâ€™s sad. Iâ€™m gonna miss everything about this place. The way it smells. The celebrities who come through. Just last week, Josh Oâ€™Connor came through,â€ Yang said, referring to last weekâ€™s â€œSNLâ€ host.

	Tonightâ€™s host Ariana Grande, who co-starred with Yang in the â€œWickedâ€ movies, also appeared and said goodbye to her friend. Playing a family member of Yangâ€™s character, Grande said, â€œI wish you were home but Iâ€™m so proud of you and all the eggnog youâ€™ve made over the years. Some of it was great, some of it was rotten.â€

	â€œAnd a lot of it got cut,â€ Yang added. â€œBut you know, I also think eggnogâ€™s kinda like me. Itâ€™s not for everyone, but the people who like it are my kinda people.â€ The two sang a song together and were joined by musical guest Cher (who played the eggnog makerâ€™s boss) on stage, and Yang teared up saying goodbye.

	â€œOh, Rhonda, I should have come home earlier,â€ he said while choking up. â€œI just feel so lucky that I ever got to work here. And I just wanted to enjoy it for a little bit longer. Especially the people. Iâ€™ve loved every single person who works here. Because theyâ€™ve done so much for me, especially my boss.â€
	

	During the final goodnights to close out the show, Grande gave a special shoutout to Yang: â€œAnd Bowen yang, we love you so much! Goodnight!â€

	Yangâ€™s mid-season departure comes after several cast members left before Season 51 began, including Ego Nwodim, Heidi Gardner, Michael Longfellow, Devon Walker, Emil Wakim and John Higgins. Leaving in the middle of a season is rare but not unheard of â€” Cecily Strong, Molly Shannon and Dana Carvey did it in the past.

	Outside of â€œSaturday Night Live,â€ Yang hosts the pop culture podcast â€œLas Culturistasâ€ with fellow comedian Matt Rogers. For the first time, the two hosted their yearly Las Culturistas Awards as a full awards show broadcast on Bravo and Peacock. Yang also reprised his â€œWickedâ€ role as Pfannee in this fallâ€™s hit â€œWicked: For Goodâ€ musical. He and Rogers are also writing and starring in an upcoming comedy for Searchlight Pictures.

schema.headline: Bowen Yang Pays Tribute to â€˜SNLâ€™ in Tearful Final Sketch: â€˜This Is My Last Shift, Iâ€™m Gonna Miss Everything About This Placeâ€™Â

title: Kate Winslet â€˜Desperately Triedâ€™ to Recast Herself in â€˜Goodbye Juneâ€™ Directorial Debut: â€˜I Cannot Do Three Jobsâ€™
description:
Kate Winslet is opening up about the challenges she faced while making her directorial debut, â€œGoodbye June.â€

	Written by her son, Joe Anders, the
body:
Kate Winslet is opening up about the challenges she faced while making her directorial debut, â€œGoodbye June.â€

	Written by her son, Joe Anders, the actress revealed that she only planned to star and produce the film. When she was also offered the opportunity to direct the feature, Winslet said that her initial thought was that she â€œcannot do three jobs.â€

	â€œI know Iâ€™m good at multitasking, but this is too many things,â€ Winslet told Digi Spy. â€œI desperately tried to recast myself [and] had a really good list of a handful of people who would have been absolutely brilliant in that role.â€
	

	She continued, â€œBut at that pointâ€¦ well, first of all, Netflix was like, â€˜Uh-uh,â€™ and secondly, Iâ€™d cast all these incredible actors. How could I not go and play with them? Because thatâ€™s what we do. We play, we pretend, and itâ€™s an amazing thing.â€


	Now playing in select theaters, â€œGoodbye Juneâ€ follows four adult siblings and their father as they navigate their family dynamic as their sick motherâ€™s health takes a turn for the worse. Winslet stars as Julia, one of Juneâ€™s children, with Helen Mirren playing June, the matriarch of the family.

	â€œI know it sounds a bit sickly, but we had to really become a family in order to make it feel as real as possible and as relatable as possible,â€ Winslet added. â€œYou canâ€™t just show up and do the job and go home again; it becomes something else. We were lucky on this film that that really happened.â€

	In addition to Winslet and Mirren, â€œGoodbye Juneâ€ stars Toni Collette, Johnny Flynn, Andrea Riseborough and Timothy Spall. Additional cast members include Stephen Merchant, Fisayo Akinade, Jeremy Swift and Raza Jaffrey.
	

	After its theatrical run, the film will arrive on Netflix on Dec. 24.

schema.headline: Kate Winslet â€˜Desperately Triedâ€™ to Recast Herself in â€˜Goodbye Juneâ€™ Directorial Debut: â€˜I Cannot Do Three Jobsâ€™

title: â€˜Dan Da Danâ€™ Confirms Season 3 Airing in 2027, Unveils New Key Visual
description: Science Saru will return with a third season of â€œDan Da Danâ€ airing in 2027, the studio revealed during Jump Festa 2026 on Dec. 21, revealing a new
body:
Science Saru will return with a third season of â€œDan Da Danâ€ airing in 2027, the studio revealed during Jump Festa 2026 on Dec. 21, revealing a new key visual for the supernatural comedy series.

	The animeâ€™s debut season aired from October to December 2024, and its second season from July to September 2025. The series adapts Yukinobu Tatsuâ€™s manga, which has sold over 12 million copies and continues serialization every Tuesday on Shueishaâ€™s manga magazine app Shonen Jump+.
	

	â€œDan Da Danâ€ centers on Momo (voiced by Shion Wakayama), a high school girl from a family of spiritual mediums, and her classmate Okarun (voiced by Natsuki Hanae), an occult enthusiast. After Momo saves Okarun from bullies, an argument erupts between the ghost-believing Momo and the alien-believing Okarun. To settle their debate, Momo visits an abandoned hospital UFO hotspot while Okarun explores a haunted tunnel, where both encounter unexpected creatures. Momo awakens hidden spiritual powers while Okarun gains curse abilities, launching them into paranormal battles and a potential romance.


	Mainichi Broadcasting System (MBS) co-produces the series. The Osaka-based broadcaster has been involved in anime production for over 50 years, including franchises such as â€œAttack on Titan,â€ â€œFull Metal Alchemist,â€ â€œJujutsu Kaisenâ€ and the influential film â€œAkira.â€

	Science Saru has produced television, film and streaming projects including â€œLu Over the Wall,â€ â€œDevilman crybaby,â€ â€œKeep Your Hands Off Eizouken!,â€ â€œInu-Ohâ€ and â€œThe Colors Within.â€ The studioâ€™s upcoming releases include TV anime series â€œThe Ghost in the Shellâ€ and â€œJaadugar: A Witch in Mongolia,â€ both planned for broadcast in 2026.

schema.headline: â€˜Dan Da Danâ€™ Confirms Season 3 Airing in 2027, Unveils New Key Visual

title: â€˜SNLâ€™ Mocks Trumpâ€™s Holiday Speech: Iâ€™m â€˜Getting My Own Hunger Gamesâ€™ to â€˜Distract From the Epstein Filesâ€™
description: During the Dec. 20 episode of â€œSaturday Night Live,â€ James Austin Johnsonâ€™s President Trump used his holiday address to parody his stranger-than-fic
body:
During the Dec. 20 episode of â€œSaturday Night Live,â€ James Austin Johnsonâ€™s President Trump used his holiday address to parody his stranger-than-fiction administration.

	Taking aim at Trumpâ€™s primetime address this week, as well as the release of more Epstein files and the presidentâ€™s announcement that heâ€™s launching â€œPatriot Gamesâ€ for elite high school athletes, Johnson went to town in the episodeâ€™s cold open.


	â€œI almost forgot: Iâ€™m getting my own Hunger Games,â€ Johnson-as-Trump said. â€œThatâ€™s right, the White House will be hosting the Patriot Games for high school athletes, because I thought, â€˜Whatâ€™s the best way to distract from the Epstein files?â€™ I know, invite a bunch of teenagers to my house!â€
	

	Trump also disputed the nationâ€™s economic unease, saying, â€œThe economy is fine, all right? The economyâ€™s fine. Itâ€™s getting closer to fine. Indigo Girls. They were one of my favorite lesbian folk rock duos. I believe that was Melissa Etheridge and, I want to say, Elton John.â€

	Trump also spoke about adding his name to the Kennedy Center, saying, â€œWe are renaming the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, which will now be called the Trump Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts. Iâ€™m actually going to be renaming a number of our other monuments as well â€¦ People are saying, â€˜Why are you putting your name on so many buildings?â€™ And I say itâ€™s because we had to take it off of so many files, Epstein redacted. We had so many Trumps in there!â€

	Watch the cold open sketch below.

title: Waymo Cars Dangerously Halted During San Francisco Power Outage
description:
Waymo Self-Driving Cars
                          Left Stalled on Major Roads During SF Power Out
body:
Waymo Self-Driving Cars
                          Left Stalled on Major Roads During SF Power Outage
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 21, 2025
                            7:32 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          San Francisco was hit with a major power outage Saturday night, turning the whole city into darkness and dangerously stalling a ton of self-driving Waymo taxis.
      
    
          The citywide outage forced Waymo to halt its driverless car service, stranding the autonomous vehicles in the middle of the streets and intersections, according to pedestrians posting videos on X Saturday.
      
    
      
      bad day to be a Waymo in SF during a PG&E-induced power outage pic.twitter.com/3SwEP993znâ€” Mishaal Abbasi (@WhereIsMishaal) December 21, 2025
              @WhereIsMishaal
          
  
    
          A Waymo spokesperson tells TMZ that ride-hailing services have been "temporarily suspended" due to the outage. They added, "Our teams are working diligently and in close coordination with city officials to monitor infrastructure stability, and we are hopeful to bring our services back online soon.â€
      
    
      
      Power out in SF and the @Waymoâ€™s are causing a MASSIVE jam in North Beach ğŸ¤£ pic.twitter.com/fuvhprlymaâ€” Iago Maciel (@_iagomaciel) December 21, 2025
              @_iagomaciel
          
  
    
          SFGATE reports the company had to shut down its operation at around 8 p.m. due to the cars being unable to operate without traffic signals.
      
    
          According to online footage, at least four Waymo vehicles were parked in the middle of an intersection with their hazards on, creating a large traffic jam at the busy intersection in the North Beach neighborhood.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          SFGATE reports thousands of San Franciscans still remain without power on Sunday morning, as PG&E crews continue to work to restore electricity after a now nearly day-long outage.
      
    
          We've reached out to Waymo, so far, no word back.
      
      
              
            
              Related articles
            
        
              
          
                          
                Cars
              
                          
                Viral
              
                          
                News

schema.headline: Waymo Cars Dangerously Halted During San Francisco Power Outage

title: Nine People Killed, 10 Injured in Mass Shooting in South Africa
description:
South African Massacre
                          9 People Dead, 10 Injured ....
body:
South African Massacre
                          9 People Dead, 10 Injured ....
                          In 2nd Recent Mass Shooting
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 21, 2025
                            6:34 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Nearly a dozen gunmen reportedly opened fire outside a bar in South Africa, killing 9 people and injuring 10.
      
    
          The mass shooting was the second in South Africa in the last 3 weeks, with the latest incident occurring early Sunday morning in Bekkersdal, a township 28 miles west of Johannesburg, according to CBS.
      

          Here's what happened ... around 12 shooters drove up in a vehicle and unloaded a barrage of bullets outside KwaNoxolo tavern, before fleeing in their car, CBS said.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          When the smoke cleared, nine people were reportedly dead and 10 more injured. The conditions of the survivors are not known.
      
    
          Police told CBS that some of the victims were randomly shot, and a ride-sharing driver -- who had just dropped off a passenger -- was among the dead.
      
    
          The Associated Press, citing a police official, said the gunmen were armed with mostly 9 millimeter semi-automatics and at least one AK-47. A manhunt is underway to capture the killers.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Earlier this month, multiple assailants shot up an unlicensed bar in the South African capital of Johannesburg, leaving 12 people dead and 13 injured. It's unclear if the 2 mass shootings are connected.
      
      
              
            
              Related articles
            
        
              
          
                          
                Shootings
              
                          
                News

schema.headline: Nine People Killed, 10 Injured in Mass Shooting in South Africa

title: 'Saturday Night Live' Rips Into Trumpâ€™s 'Hunger Games' Speech
description:
'Saturday Night Live'
                          Takes Jabs at Trump's 'Patriot Games' ...
body:
'Saturday Night Live'
                          Takes Jabs at Trump's 'Patriot Games' ...
                          And Epstein Files Redaction
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 21, 2025
                            7:14 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          "Saturday Night Live" is once again parodying President Donald Trump -- this time, taking jabs at his recent holiday speech that included the announcement of his "Patriot Games" ... in light of the Jeffrey Epstein files dropping Friday.
      
    
          James Austin Johnson opens the show in his famed Trump attire, standing in front of an identical fireplace as 47 was late last week ... and immediately mocks his 'Hunger Games' idea. He says, "Whatâ€™s the best way to distract from the Epstein files? I know, invite a bunch of teenagers to my house!" As you know, his "Patriot Games" is meant to showcase elite high school athletes.
      
    
      
      Trump delivers a holiday message from the White House pic.twitter.com/37WpSWYYDd
              @nbcsnl
          
  
    
          The actor took another shot at Trump by criticizing his name being added to the Kennedy Center, saying in character ... "People are saying, 'Why are you putting your name on so many buildings?â€™ And I say itâ€™s because we had to take it off of so many files, Epstein redacted. We had so many Trumps in there!â€
      
    
          This likely references the suspicion that several files -- at least 16 files, according to AP -- have gone MIA from the Justice Departmentâ€™s Epstein Files drop from Friday. This reportedly includes a snapshot of Trump and images that show a painting depicting nude women.
      
    
          Internet sleuths caught on to the allegedly vanished pic of Trump earlier Saturday, and Democrats on the House Oversight Committee publicly questioned Attorney General Pam Bondi about it. So far, no word back ...

title: Jeffrey Epstein Seen Playing With Possible Child in DOJ Photos
description:
Jeffrey Epstein Files
                          Pedo's Playtime In New DOJ Pics
body:
Jeffrey Epstein Files
                          Pedo's Playtime In New DOJ Pics
                          ... Is That A Kid?
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 21, 2025
                            5:16 AM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  December 21, 2025
                                7:13 AM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Suffice to say, Jeffrey Epstein should never have been allowed to be around children ... but, as these Department of Justice photos show, the pedophile was having a good time with someone who appears to be a kid.
      
    
          Check 'em out ... The grainy pics capture Epstein sitting on a floor while acting playfully toward someone who looks like a minor. The DOJ redacted the person's image and did not provide their age or gender, so we can't know for sure, but there are some clues.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          In one pic, you see Epstein staring at the person who appears to be an adolescent. Another photo shows Epstein leaning in and making a face at the youngster. In another image, Epstein is peering down at the youth with a slight grin. See it all for yourself.
      

          We should note ... it's unclear what their relationship was ... if their interactions were purely innocent or if there was something more nefarious going on.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          As you know, the DOJ released the first batch of the Epstein Files on Friday after President Trump signed a bill ordering them to be made public. The files contain thousands of photos, videos, and documents related to the decades-old Epstein saga in which the late financier and his longtime lover, Ghislaine Maxwell, allegedly sex trafficked underage girls.
      
    
          Many of the DOJ photos show Epstein with the rich and famous, namely Bill Clinton, Mick Jagger, Chris Tucker, David Copperfield, and Richard Branson.
